result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall K. Richtmyre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $2,643.45 plus surcharges.
Spend 6 months in the county jail, comm forthwith.  Credit for 125 days served.  May not have contact with William Tremper, known felons, or known drug dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Participate in any and all programming deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  Maintain a stable residence.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges allowed.  Credit for 125 days served.
AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION court imposes 120 days KCJ.  When/If the Deft successfully completes the Living Free Program while in jail, the balance of jail time shall be stayed.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Brett Copeland.  Probation agent Patricia Bey appeared.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. has violated conditions of probation.  Recommendations made by counsel.  Court orders 120 days in Co. Jail as an alternative to revocation of probation.  When/if def. successfully completes the Living Free Program while in jail, the balance of jail time he may have left to serve shall be stayed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  Counts 1 thru 7 and 15 thru 21 -  Court imposes and stays 36 months in the WSP with 18 months Initial followed by 18 months Extended Supervision.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 6 months in the KCJ forthwith with credit for 125 days.  All counts are concurrent.  Restitution is ordered and parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $2643.45.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
received from Defendant
DE's Participation in Living Free Program

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty to Counts 1 through 7 as well as Counts 15 through 21.  Counts 8 through 14 and Counts 22 through 28 are Dismissed and Read In.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 9/10/15 at 10:00 AM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Greg Bates. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-23-15 @ 9:10am. Bond continued.
